data.title: Great people watching spot
data.text: Monument Circle always seems to be hopping every time I visit downtown Indy. It's a lot nicer than it used to be, and has plenty of small businesses as well as recognized brands (like the tiny Starbucks!). Great place to sit and enjoy an ice cream or hot chocolate, and just people watch.

data.title: great, especially at Christmas time
data.text: Monument Circle is no doubt the heart of Indianapolis. Surrounded by shops, good restaurants, and near to most of the city's major museums, this is the best place from which to launch a visit of the Circle City! It is especially nice to visit at Christmas time when the monument becomes the world's largest non-tree Christmas tree and you can enjoy a nice horse-drawn carriage ride!

data.title: Right in the middle of the city
data.text:
Waiting for the Christmas lights to be lit, which is always a treat to see. Monument Circle looks awesome all lit up!

There's a Starbucks on the Circle if you need a Java and also don't miss the public art installation with FREE BOOKS!

data.title: Beautiful Centerpiece to a Dynamic City!
data.text:
Indianapolis is a welcoming city with something for everyone!  Monument Circle has seasonal beauty and celebrations throughout the entire year.  

The moument is a tribute to our military and there is a great museum on the lower level.  

Enjoy "tree" lighting the night after USA Thanksgiving or lunch on the steps of a sunny summer afternoon, or perhaps indulging in strawberries and ice cream during Strawberry Festival.  

A welcome place to visit, take photos', a bit of rest or begin a day of shopping or exploring all the delights of Indy!

data.title: Very pretty
data.text: Near the center of the downtown area and is a nice relaxing walk day or night.  Starting in mid-November, they hang lights from the top that makes the monument look like a giant Christmas tree.

data.title: Great especially during the Holidays!
data.text: The center- Crossroad- of the City. The Friday after Thanksgiving is the lighting of the tree as pictured above. There are year round horse and buggy rides and lots of restaurants both on the Circle and nearby. A must see if you visit the City.

data.title: Charming at night
data.text: It's not just the monument that's lit up. It's the horse drawn carriages that have their own lighting reminiscent of the Cinderella story offering romantic rides to tourists. Fountains flow during the day.

data.title: Unexpectedly lovely walk around Indianapolis
data.text: I had just a morning to spend to get a taste of Indianapolis. I think I made a great choice by walking around the monument area. There are several ornate and beautiful war memorials from every major conflict, organized in a lovely walk in parkland. I had no idea that Indianapolis had so much gorgeous architecture and public art (fountains, sculptures) and I was inspired to learn about the City Beautiful movement from the early 19th century, of which Indianapolis is a prime example. It was easy to find a metered street parking spot ($1 per hour). There are many cafes or restaurants near the Civil War Memorial if you are hungry. I definitely felt like I learned a lot about Indianapolis and got a feel for the city by taking this walk.

data.title: HIGHLIGHT OF INDY
data.text: Nothing is more beautiful than downtown Indianapolis at Christmas.  The circle and monument is lit brightly with streams of lights so much so it looks like daylight.  It is fun to walk the circle, go up into the monument or take a carriage ride around Indy which, by the way,  are available year round. The Hilbert Circle Theater hosts many shows, dining to suit all tastes and parking garages for your convenience.  I LOVE INDY!!

data.title: Glad I saw it!
data.text: In the center of the street is a GIANT memorial. It is a very impressive monument is a must see.  While we did not go inside, there was literature on the outside.  This memorial is also surrounded by many stores and within walking distance of the mall, convention center and Lucas Oil Stadium.

data.title: Attraction in the centre of the city
data.text:
Monument circle is at the crossroads of the centre of the city and is a wonderful memorial. You can go to the top of the memorial ( free if you want to climb the stairs or a couple of dollars to take the lift)
Great 360 views from the top. 
This is a must place for pictures

data.title: Beautiful ay Christmas
data.text: Take the whole family will love it  it's a sight to see and very beautiful go late at night, traffic will be better. Also grab a hot chocolate on the circle.

data.title: Visit often,  Great City and everything is within walking distant.  Very safe and Clean
data.text: This is a Wonderful City to visit.  Everything is within walking distant if you stay downtown.  Restaurants, Museums, Night life, and Zoo

data.title: Beautiful Attraction
data.text: What a nice and unique center of town.  I enjoyed the monument and everything else in the area.  It is worth walking around.

data.title: Beautiful at night
data.text: After checking into our hotel, we walked around the area. It was beautiful with the trees lit up around the circle, the horses and carriages lined up and clip clopping through the streets. We felt very safe in the area.

data.title: Remembering our past
data.text: The Monument Circle is a great place to visit. The elevator is now working for those who are not able the climb the stairs to the top.  The view at the top is a beautiful 360* view of the city of Indianapolis. The stairs have plagues that were donated to remember individuals and organizations that donated toward the renovation of the monument. There are displays of historical importance in the Monument and the outside as well.

data.title: Big monument on the central square
data.text: When are you going to visit Indianapolis downtown this big monument in the center of the square, is impossible that you don`t see it.

data.title: Indy Must-See
data.text: The iconic Monument Circle is a must-see when visiting Indianapolis--if only to understand the reasoning behind the Circle City moniker. The inticate details carved into the Bedford stone monument are unbelievable. Check out the four statues around the base for some Indiana history. I saw two wedding parties on my recent visit. It's obviously an iconic spot for locals. Downtown workers often sit on the steps at lunchtime and horse-drawn carriages are readily available in the evening for rides on the brick streets around downtown. For a real treat, climb the 300+steps to the top of the monument--or take the elevator--for a special view. The monument becomes a giant Christmas tree on Black Friday and is aglow to early January.

data.title: A must see when in Indy
data.text: Monument circle is a must see when in Indy, the solders and sailors monument is amazing and there our cool shops. Visit the candy shop is has interesting sodas and Japanese candies. The small church on a corner is quaint and historic. The circle is close to all of the other monuments and the Scottish Rite Cathedral

data.title: A pleasant surprise in downtown!
data.text: Quaint shops and restaurants in this cobblestoned rotunda ! Lots to do and see, with the Soldiers and Sailors Monument right in the centre! Gorgeous!
